article: In 1896, 17-year-old Einstein went to Zurich to study physics. There he met Marits, a girl _ Hungary. They studied in the same class and the same interest in physics brought the two together and they became good _ . Before long, they fell in love with each other. In 1903, when Einstein was 24, he married Marits, who was four years older than he.  _ their marriage, Einstein _ himself to the research of the great theory of relativity. To give her husband more help, Marits gave _ her own work, and became a good wife and _ . She tried her best to encourage him _ possible. She was sure that her husband _ succeed. They often discussed the theory while _ outside or sitting together in the room. They _ did that in their letters when one of them was _ from home.  In 1914, the Einsteins moved to Berlin and _ down there. At that time, Einstein's theory _ to be correct and he became _ all over the world. Marits was very proud of her husband with his success. But it was not long before the First World War broke out . Marits as well as her two sons, who were _ holidays in Switzerland, couldn't come back to _ any longer. The war not only stopped Einstein's work but also broke _ the warm, happy family. In 1919, Einstein and Marits had to get divorced.
